result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristopher G Hansen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kristopher G Hansen in court with attorney Carly June Sebion and James Ritland.  Gerald Roger Fox appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA Fox states there is a joint recommendation:  Defendant will plead to Count 1 in 14CF90 and Count 1 in 15CF66.  Recommendation for sentencing is:  3 years probation concurrent on both cases with 90 days conditional jail on 14CF90 and with 4 days sentence credit; may serve on EMP and in Vernon County if arrangements can be made; To be on SCRAM for 1 year after conditional jail has been served; may report to jail on or before March 1, 2016.  Additional sentence on 14CF90 - $600 fine plus costs; $69 restitution to Jackson County Jail for blood test costs; alcohol assessment and DSP; DL revocation of 24 months and IID 24 months.  Will plea to Count 1 in 14CF90; Count 15CF66.  There is joint recommendation of probation 3 years on both with conditions of Probation:  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Court performs plea colloquy/reviews waiver of rights/elements.  Attorney Ritland stipulates to the factual basis in the complaint in 14CF90; attorney Sebion stipulates to the factual basis in the complaint in 15CF66.  Defendant admits to 3 prior convictions for OWI/PAC.  Court finds defendant understands the proceedings, he freely voluntarily entered his plea and waived his rights; Court accepts his pleas and finds him guilty.  Court performs plea colloquy/reviews rights/elements with defendant.  Court finds he freely and voluntarily enters his plea/waives his rights and finds him guilty of Count 1 - 14CF90 and Count 1 - 15CF66;  Case 15CF112 is dismissed and read-in; Count 2 in 14CF90 is dismissed and read-in, and Count 3 is dismissed outright; 14TR2043 - Refusal is found reasonable and is dismissed.  Court accepts the sentencing recommendation as stated.  9 months jail to begin on or before 3/1/16 by 6:00 with credit for 4 days served; all other recommendations ordered as stated, plus a DNA sample to be submitted on 15CF66 plus pay the surcharge; surcharge also on 15CF66 and to pay the court costs.

No reporter - Judge Goodman by phone.  Defendant present with both counsel SPD Carly Sebion and James Ritland present.  DA Fox appeared for the State.  All cases will be resolved and can be set for plea/sentencing on 2/5/16 at 9:00 a.m.  All counsel agree a PSI is not needed.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent.  The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Must report to Jackson County Sheriff's Office or any local law enforcement agency where you live for the random testing.
same appearances.  Waive reading of information.  NGP entered.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody, in person, with Attorney Sebion.  Form filed with court.  Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of time limits.  Defendant stated he understood the waiver.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his time limits.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Sebion appeared in court.  Recall at 2:45 pm today to do waiver of preliminary hearing.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant FTA for AIA.  Attorney Sebion appeared.  Warrant authorized.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared without counsel.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties.  Defendant understood.  Defendant wants an attorney.  Options explained.  AIA set for 8/17/15 at 9:30 am.  Bond set.

This bond covers 15CF66 & 15CF112:  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent.  The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Must report to Jackson County Sheriff's Office or any local law enforcement agency where you live for the random testing.  

Must report to Jackson County Jail for booking.
